headline: Disney vs. Netflix: Which media giant has the higher valuation?
summary: Disney (DIS) stock soared in Wednesday's session after reporting fiscal second quarter results that beat estimates, the entertainment giant subsequently lifting its profit outlook as it sees further growth in its theme park business. But how does the House of Mouse's valuation and P/E ratio (price-earnings) stack up to streaming service Netflix (NFLX)? Yahoo Finance senior media reporter Allie Canal compares the valuations and trader activities of both of these major media companies, underlining what each bring to the table. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Disney’s Tariff Resilience Is a Surprise — Heard on the Street
summary: Disney’s share price jumped Wednesday morning after the entertainment giant posted surprisingly strong quarterly results.  Domestic parks operating income of $1.8 billion was 10% ahead of expectations, according to consensus estimates from Visible Alpha.  Investors had worried about Disney’s exposure to the wide swath of tariffs unveiled by President Trump last month.

headline: Netflix debuts its generative AI-powered search tool
summary: After hinting at a new AI-powered search experience during its recent earnings call, Netflix officially unveiled the feature at its tech and product event on Wednesday. This new search experience will utilize OpenAI’s ChatGPT to provide users with a conversational discovery experience. headline: Netflix is getting into short videos with a new vertical feed for mobile
summary: Netflix announced on Wednesday that it’s testing a short-form video feature, signaling that even a streaming giant with over 300 million subscribers is concerned about losing viewers’ time spent on mobile to apps like TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and Instagram Reels. The company debuted the feature at its first-ever product and tech event, where it also revealed several other upcoming plans for the service. These plans include an AI-powered search tool, as well as a redesign of the TV homepage and im
